Reviews.Title: Sony KDL 32bx320
Reviews.Author: RBT778
Reviews.Content: This base grade 2011 model does all that is expected at this price point and resolution. Very clear picture with just a hint of graying in the black areas. The 5.1 audio out is great for older style A/V receivers that don't handle HDMI input. One digital audio (toslink) cable from the tv handles all audio to the receiver that was input to the tv via HDMI. Easy set up but swivel base would have been nice. One piece of deceptive  advertising is the PIP funtion. Only available if you are in PC mode. Don't expect to get PIP from two sources unless one is main screen PC. The matte screen handles reflected light well and the glare from the frame is bearable. Very little motion blurring at this screen size with 60hz response and back lit flourescent versus LED isn't worth the extra money. Good solid buy at this price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: R. Kavuri
Reviews.Content: This Sony HDTV provides unbelievable options for picture selection and audio selection. The modes are pre-calibrated by Sony and I just love the various scene selection options, I just need to switch between the various modes based on the need (I just use the Game Mode and Movie Mode).I notice a lot of people complaining about the sound in their HDTV. I like the audio output on this Sony HDTV compared to the Samsung C350 that I owned before this one.Additionally, the remote has the option to control other HDMI output devices such as a blu ray player or a PS3. You can also connect a USB device to this HDTV and play songs or photos.I was not too impressed initially by the picture output but later realized that dullness in the picture was due to the light sensor, once I turned it off everything looks picture perfect. This is a 2011 model, and I guess there is no Sony HDTV that would provide you all these options for this price range.

Reviews.Title: Superior TV
Reviews.Author: 70's_Rule "mb"
Reviews.Content: I've purchased and returned 2 LCD TVs: a Samsung 40" LCD in 2008, and a Panasonic VIERA 32" LCD just a few weeks ago.  Both of these seemed to be good TVs, but IMHO the Sony Bravia blows them both away, especially considering that Amazon's price is significantly cheaper vs the others.The set-up was very fast and simple.  I used the enclosed TV stand for my Bravia and it took less than 5 minutes to assemble.  The TV is extremely stable on the base, even a little more so than the Panasonic.  I had no qualms about setting it on top of a small, sturdy dresser to get some height for better viewing.The only snags I encountered at all were with setting up the HDMI interfaces between my Lenovo laptop computer and Panasonic DVD player/recorder.  At first the picture quality was marginal, but I think the HDMI settings must take some time to sort out.  The TV seems to be smart enough to eventually get everything set, and the laptop's external viewer settings did identify the Sony television and once that was done, I could make some changes to the view settings to get what I wanted.  (When I changed from the PC HDMI input to another source and back, the Panasonic TV wouldn't show the computer input and I'd often have to reboot the computer to get it to show right.)  So, patience is required to get your view settings as desired, but this TV can handle just about any preference!It's possible the Panasonic might have had a slightly "crisper" picture and less darkening effects with some movies, etc.  But I just turned up the backlight on the Sony and no more worries.  The sound on the Sony, however, is superior IMHO.PROS:Excellent remote control with logical labels.  ALL the buttons serve a useful purpose and their purposes can be learned intuitively and quickly through use.Ease of changing viewing width/angles to accommodate quality of source signal, on the rare occasion the TV didn't get it right the first time.Great sound quality and functions - RCA out jacks are critical!Video motion seemed very smooth - I have ear/balance/migraine issues and even so I didn't get a nauseated/dizzy feeling as much as I did with the Panasonic or Samsung (though the Sam's screen was too big for the room).Current price at Amazon - $358.99?!CONS:Dark/night scenes in movies could be a little "too dark" unless the backlight was increased.  I suppose this might shorten the life of the TV, but I don't think it's necessary to do this except for certain programming.Like most LCD TVs in this price range, the internal speakers are marginal.  I'm currently looking for a cheap external audio solution (e.g., higher-end self-powered computer speakers with an adapter to the RCA out jacks)This is a safe investment in a quality, solid TV - the cheaper TV models weren't "enough cheaper" to warrant taking the risk.  For a bedroom or small living room the SONY Bravia LCD 32" is simply unbeatable for the price.

Reviews.Title: high quality and great value
Reviews.Author: S. Laubengayer
Reviews.Content: Easy set up, very light weight, spectacular picture and color, sound is good but I have it in a close enclosure in a bedroom. I did a lot of online and local store shopping and think this a great value. No need for more pixels in this size set,details are very sharp.

Reviews.Title: Couldnt be happier
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: I havent even had the tv for 24 hours and already i am super pleased.  one other customer stated that this is a 1080p tv and not 720p.  this is not accurate.  the tv simply accepts 1080p signals via HDMI.  if the tv did not have this built in, you would either have to downgrade the source, or you would just get a blank screen.  this is only a 720p tv.that being said, its crisp, its lightweight, doesnt produce alot of heat, deep blacks, bright whites, and great color.  i dont use the speakers, as i have a sony soundbar for space saving reasons.  plenty of options inside the menu for customization.  it may be a smidge more expensive than some other comparable tv's, but it is well worth the price and its still more than affordable.

Reviews.Title: Great Entry Level Set
Reviews.Author: Weltbild
Reviews.Content: Pleased with the set overall.The audio could be better as the speakers face behind the set and need to be loud to hear the set well (but doing it that way seems to improve the sound tone somewhat). No jack for headphones, nor can the remote adjust the volume of the RCA audio outputs (I have to listen through headphones by connecting my headphones to the cable set top box, and then change the cable box settings every time I switch from speakers to headphones).Picture quality (black levels, contrast) seems excellent, with color looking pretty accurate to my eyes right out of the box. Without a colorimeter or spectroradiometer and software for precise measuring, it's difficult to say much empirically. I read that the Bravia3 engine improves standard definition (SD) quality somewhat from last year's BX300 model that has the Bravia2 engine. Not having watched a BX300, I can't say if the BX320 is that much better or not, but it certainly improves on the SD picture quality of other brand's sets I've tried out over the last few years and eventually returned, mostly because of SD picture fuzziness.I have most all the picture adjustment features for reducing noise set to off, and use the Cinema mode.Another similar set, the BX420, may be better if you plan to hookup a computer using HDMI (1080p looks better for this).Even though Sony doesn't manufacture these sets in Japan anymore, I'm hoping the reliabilty and longevity I've had with other Sony televsions in the past will continue with this set.

Reviews.Title: A Sony For Less Than $400
Reviews.Author: T. Wattenbarger
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this model. For one, it's a Sony 32" LCD HDTV, and it's only $378! I wasn't expecting it to blow me out of the water, and there are no bells and whistles, but this is exactly what I wanted, a base model 32" HDTV, and it's what I got. All the picture modes look great, the speakers are awesome for what they are, and I can't be more happy. Sure, it could of had a headphone jack, maybe a few more HDMI ports, but I could care less about those miniscule features. Arrived quickly, no damage or anything during shipment. My PS3 looks amazing now, and WOW, Blurays look beyond explanation. I would definitely recommend this TV for it's low price and amazing picture/sound.Sony!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia KDL32BX320
Reviews.Author: C. Moschetto "Carol"
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  I read the review in Consumer Reports and decided on the TV.  Found the best price on the net, and arrived quickly and as promised.  Sound is great and picture is great.  Easy set up.

Reviews.Title: Average 32" TV
Reviews.Author: TFB
Reviews.Content: This 32" TV is good, not great. I thought that the TV was able to get bright enough for that pop in contrast that I like to see. I calibrate all my TVs based on using various calibration Blu-Rays as well as utilizing AVS forum user suggestions. While this may not be as good as a professional calibration, it usually works out well. I had this TV stacked up against the TCL 32", LG 32LK450 and Samsung 32" 360 series. In the end, the TCL 32" seemed to provide an acceptable picture but not as detailed as the others, but it was able to provide better contrast than the LG & Sony (I was surprised as well). In the end, I stuck with my Samsung as I felt the picture was not as soft as the Sony and LG and provided enough contrast and sharpness to edge the others out. If you can get this TV for under $250, then it may be worth it.

Reviews.Title: A nice TV at a good price.
Reviews.Author: Richard "My Opinion"
Reviews.Content: The picture is sharp with good contrast and sound. The factory adjustments were almost perfect and required very few changes.This is the second one I purchased from Amazon.  The first was given as a gift and after seeing how pleased the recipient wasI decided to buy one for myself.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: Peter Chesebrough "mac guy"
Reviews.Content: Just received the Bravia X320 last week, easily unboxed it, put it on it's stand using VERY brief instructions, and connected it to my Charter cable line and power. It lit up, and after doing quick setup procedure, I was welcomed with a great picture and audio. I am keeping the box it came in for a while, but so far, everything is working perfectly!

Reviews.Title: Good (but not great) TV for the price
Reviews.Author: B. McIntyre
Reviews.Content: I wanted a good flat-screen for our bedroom that wasn't too big and had a good picture. So I ordered this TV with free shipping on late Monday night from Amazon for the price of $298. I received it 36 hours later on Wednesday morning. I could not ask for better delivery service.It was easy to set up the base for the TV - one screwdriver and 5 minutes later it's ready to go. Note that the base is fixed - it does not swivel which would have been nice. Also note that the base is quite sturdy - unlike the base for the Samsung LN32D450 that I was also considering. Simple hook-up for the HDMI cable (MediaBridge $9.99 6' HDMI cable also ordered from Amazon). I powered it on and ran through a few simple set-up menus and it's ready to watch. Very easy to set up.Picture is quite good but not awesome at 720p and 60hz specs. It's exactly what I expected from a $300 flat-screen. Sound is adequate but certainly not outstanding - again just what I expected. I'm sure a basic sound bar would improve the sound but at about $200, that would add considerably to the cost of the unit.Overall, a good TV at this price. I had watched the prices on decide.com and bought when it said the price was at the lowest point for this time frame. I feel that I got a good solid TV for a good price. My second choice to buy would have been the Samsung LN32D450 but its price was higher and the base was very wobbly. I also like the Sony picture over the Samsung's vividness. I feel that I got exactly what I ordered and I am very satisfied with my choice.

Reviews.Title: sony 32 in lcd tv
Reviews.Author: Joyce T. Patterson "teach"
Reviews.Content: Great tv for bedroom.Color is great and picture is clear and detailed. The remote is another matter. The volume and channel buttons are at the end of the remote and make it very awkward to use.Of course there is no backlight which would be a wonderful asset.

Reviews.Title: Love it, no problems
Reviews.Author: Richard G.
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a few weeks now. I'll just say I am very happy with everything about this TV and only mention a few minor things I had a little trouble with.The first is my disappointment there is no input for headphones. I found that a little surprising since a headphone jack is basically ubiquitous on TV sets today.The second problem was that the TV would automatically change it's input source to HDMI whenever I turned on the LG BD650 3D Network Blu-ray Disc Player with Smart TV. My cable box is connected to the Component input, and the Blu-ray player is connected to the HDMI input. My family usually presses the "All On" button on the cable remote to turn on/off the TV. Doing so would turn on the blu-ray player and the TV would auto select that as the input source. I found this highly annoying. But I was able to find the control setting on the TV to disable that feature. Everything works fine now.I have not yet plugged into the PC input on the TV to test that feature. Nor have I yet plugged in a USB device.I have one additional HDMI input, which I'll probably reserve for an Xbox 360 4GB Console.

Reviews.Title: great little tv
Reviews.Author: E. Padula "gene9p"
Reviews.Content: beautiful picture and easy setup...many picture modes and adjustments..can accept 1080p via hdmi inputs...I am using this as a PC monitor and it is fantastic for gaming with no stuttering or response time issues at all..I am not concerned about sound as most tv's in this size and price range have average or below average sound compared to bigger pricier sets..and since it is being used with my 5.1 pc sound setup it is a non issue for me

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Hugh Arnold "Leaking"
Reviews.Content: Sony has another great product.  The only downfall is that the PIP is set in one of five positions and has three preset sizes.  For some reason "PIP" is not available like it used to be in the 20" -32" models by any maker.  You have to watch the model numbers very closely because the name is the same and different features are available with only one number changed. The Sony Brovia must come in 100 different model numbers. and when advertised, most of the time, they just say "Sony Brovia" with an inch size.  I got what I wanted and it took some time to figure this out.  Also, I discovered that "sales persons" don't know the difference between the models and half of them told me that I couldn't get PIP in a 32" model. I use it for a computer monitor with Television on the side and since I can't see that well it works out very well for me in the 32".  I didn't want a 50" which people kept trying to sell me.  I now have 2 of these and might buy a back up and put away since it was so hard to find what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: S. Siu
Reviews.Content: We'd been looking to replace our 23 year old 27" Trinitron and were leaning towards a Samsung 32" LCD which had been on sale elsewhere, but it sold out. Then I saw the Bravia BX32 at Amazon marked down to $298. We had some Amazon gift cards, so we pulled the trigger with free shipping. TV arrived in just 2 days. It was easy to assemble the base. Easy to set up on our cable. We have basic cable with a mixture of analog, digital, and HD channels. The TV is able to correctly size the various signals on the different channels, and remembers the zoom settings you choose for each channel. Picture is vivid, bright, and clear. The auto dimming makes it a little too dark in our room, so we aren't using that feature. The screen is nice and nonglare. Very happy to have a Sony at a bargain TV price.

Reviews.Title: Sony BRAVIA KDL32BX320 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV, Black
Reviews.Author: gojo
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with Amazon's pricing and service. TheSony is a great value for the money. I can't tell it's a 720p.

Reviews.Title: Sony KDL32BX320
Reviews.Author: Jill M. Lee
Reviews.Content: I do like this television.  It is the perfect size for my family room.  But when I received it, the one of the (2) HDMI ports did not work.  I contacted Sony, and they sent me a new t.v.  It was quite simple, except that I had to give them a credit card number to secure that I sent back the defective one.  Still a great picture.

Reviews.Title: Great television!
Reviews.Author: B. McEwan "yellokat"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased 3 LCD televisions in the past 6 months, two for my own home and one as a gift for a family member. Of the 3, this SONY Bravia delivers the best picture and performance for the price, which says a lot considering that the other 2 are a Samsung 40 inch 1080p and an LG 42 inch 1080p, both of which are higher resolution.This SONY puts out a fine picture, with good blacks and enough contrast so that you can clearly see the action that takes place in dark scenes. I like its matte screen, which doesn't reflect a lot of room light and is also good when we watch it in bed with the lights out. The set was easy to set up and it has a decent remote with clearly labeled buttons.One of its big pluses is that it interfaces smoothly with our cable remote, which we have to use to control the set when its hooked up to our cable box (which is always). We have another television, a Samsung, that refuses to work well with the cable remote and this is a big headache. This SONY, on the other hand, operates very well with the cable remote. One click turns both the cable box and the television set on or off, plus adjusts audio and changes channels. So simple!I was hesitant about getting a 720p because I worried that the picture would not be crisp, but I figured that since this one was intended as a secondary TV for the bedroom it wouldn't matter that much. It turns out that I needn't have worried, as I can't tell the difference between this picture and the picture that comes out of our (supposedly) better Samsung. And the price for this unit is excellent.Overall, a great set for a great price. Terrific value!

Reviews.Title: Good product for a great price.
Reviews.Author: Omar Alvarez
Reviews.Content: I was really amazed that a Sony television would sell for this price. I could've gotten the 1080p Sony Bravia, but this one was a little bit cheaper but with almost no difference to the other one.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money
Reviews.Author: Mark C.
Reviews.Content: nothing to say about this except a great picture nothing to say about this except a great picture. happy I got it

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia 32 inch LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Lilyput "Lilyput"
Reviews.Content: This television is everything we expected it would be.  We ordered it for our bedroom, because we were so happy with the 55" Sony Bravia we have in our great room.  This is a great bargain for the money.  The TV arrived in excellent condition from Amazon and was exceptionally easy to set up in just a few minutes.  We felt assured ordering it from Amazon, because everything we've ordered has been in excellent condition upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Amazing Price
Reviews.Author: saig
Reviews.Content: This TV is being viewed under analog streaming, however picture is stunningly clear.  I have not yet viewed it under blu-ray or DVD, but am more than confident it will blow me away.  Sound is very clear as well.  I would say best TV in the price and size range, you can't go wrong with this product.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding LCD TV
Reviews.Author: P. M.
Reviews.Content: I bought a Sony BRAVIA KDL32BX320 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV from Amazon a few weeks ago at a very good price.  It is a great TV with beautiful picture and sound.  Also, thanks amazon.com for such a great price and fast delivery at no cost. I highly recommend this TV for a small room.

Reviews.Title: If only all of it worked
Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: The picture is beautiful; that is if you can get the plugs in the back to work with what you hook it up to. After owning this TV now for a few months, I often have to unplug and plug back in my XBOX and receiver as it will just give out randomly. I tried brand new wires and connecting different things and it still does it. I lost my last Sony TV after four years of life and I get the feeling that this one that was gifted new to me won't survive nearly that long...

Reviews.Title: Great TV works great on ps3
Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: I remember wondering whether this TV could handle fast pace game play because there are a lot of HDTV's out there that aren't meant for games. This TV is definitely great for games I play MW3 and noticed no input lag unlike some of the TV's my friends have. The TV's picture is also great and it works as a good monitor. I was able to buy this TV at $298 which was practically a steal.

Reviews.Title: Sony Confident
Reviews.Author: John Kurzynowski
Reviews.Content: After a through search for a 32" LCD for my den, I became more and more confused with all of the descriptions, specs and reviews I read.  So I decided to go with old reliable, "SONY".  I was not disappointed.  After an easy setup I turned her on and immediately, I knew I made the right choice.  Great picture, solid audio and nice presentation.  For a 32"LCD you do not need a 1080p, 120Hz or 240Hz.  You just need a SONY BRAVIA 32-Inch, 720p.  When my TV comes on and I see "SONY" appear on the screen I know I'm no longer confused.

Reviews.Title: Sony TV Quality
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey C. Kimmel
Reviews.Content: We have two Sony HD TV's in our home and they are both AMAZING!  The first television I owned was a Sony and I stand by the brand and its quality.  You cannot go wrong with Sony.  The picture quality is unmatched and the sound and video options are easy to set to give you the optimum viewing experience.  The product was delivered on time and safely with no damage. Sony and Amazon are a great combination!

Reviews.Title: I would not recommend this TV
Reviews.Author: Leigh A. Dickson "Leighann"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV late December and it was great, just what we was looking for. We don't have cable or sat, so we only use it connected to my Roku.  The system has been maintained perfectly. 5 months later and it started "acting" up. The menu system started flipping out like there was a ghost in the machine, the resets wouldn't work, next the volumn set itself to Max and we couldn't reset the machine at all. We updated the 1 firmware update and nothing.  We've talked with Sony technical support for hours and they couldn't figure out a way to resolve these issues.  So here we are with a worthless machine.  Sony has a 1 year manufacturers warrantee to replace, but we really don't want to replace it if it is going to break in months.  The refund policy here is a month, nothing should go bad in a month (Nothing should really go bad in a year!) We're hoping the reseller will come through and let us exchange it for a similar Samsung model but we haven't heard back yet.  Is it really too much to ask nowadays for a product to last more than a few months?  Is this what we have come to?  Money is hard earned for us and this was a treat so we're extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Nimrod "the man"
Reviews.Content: Bought a Samsung.  I was very pleased with it but it lacked the audio outputs I needed for my soundbar.  I then bought an off brand from Best Buy.  It looked good in the store but when I hooked it up, I could not find one thing I liked about it.  Poor picture, slow response, loud but fuzzy sound.  I then bought this Sony.  I am now extremely happy.  I also love the fact that thanks to Bravia sync, I only have to use one remote to control my tv, soundbar and dvd player. My dvd player isn't even a sony, but the remote works with it perfectly. Love this tv.

Reviews.Title: Still miss my old school TV
Reviews.Author: Heywood Jablome
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad TV. I guess it does what it's designed to. Has a decent picture, HD channels do give an outstanding picture but the regular channels I was used to watching just don't show right on this "widescreen" platform. I prolly still have to play with the many many settings to get the picture I miss from my old CRT tube. Good price for a good TV. I did not expect breathtaking quality at around $350.

Reviews.Title: pretty good decent tv
Reviews.Author: Giovani L.
Reviews.Content: this is a four star because its decent looking tv and basic for watching movies and play some video games but not the best.this was for my brother who doesn't really care about motion blur or if it has decent black levels, this tv is perfect for him because its great source of hd content even though it may not be the best. 32 inch display is big enough for a room and i recommend this tv to anyone looking for budget tv that looks good and stands on top like the rest of the lcd tv i've seen.

Reviews.Title: Great View. Great Value
Reviews.Author: Lovell Tsalhatu
Reviews.Content: Bang for the buck! You cannot imagine the value I got for USD$200. I will buy this all over just for the feeling of being lucky getting at that rate the first time. Hooks up plug and play to all my devices - laptop, HDMI, PC, cable you name it. PnP also available.

Reviews.Title: Not bad!
Reviews.Author: Sammy
Reviews.Content: Sony isn't a bad TV at all.  My only complaint is the sound quality.  I have to almost have the vol up all the way to hear anything decent out of it.  I guess it's the location of the speaks.

Reviews.Title: For the price, not bad
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Phillips
Reviews.Content: If you want really great sounds, this is not the TV for you.  I had to add external speakers to get the sound to a decent level.  This was mentioned in other reviews, so beware if you buy it.

Reviews.Title: An ok tv
Reviews.Author: Allison M. Balcerak "Aly B"
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV on black Friday last year and it's been a decent TV. It sits on its stand fine and has never fallen over. My only complaint is the sound quality; if you turn the volume up to hear a person mumbling or whispering on screen you can get a weird humming noise when they speak. Some have said this could be fixed with external speakers but we haven't tried it yet. Otherwise it has a nice picture and a modest size.

Reviews.Title: Sony Tv LcD 32 Inch
Reviews.Author: jesus baduil
Reviews.Content: first of all this tv is great I have one year with it I worked fine this tv have 2 hdmi connection for connect ps3 bluray player an other devices... and 1 optical for speaker system this is an awesome purchase i recommeded this Tv to anyone that want update its old Tv thank amazon again for the service

Reviews.Title: Sony 32" LCD
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I am a REAL advocate of Samsung and are always my first choice,however,when I was remodelling an area of my basement I asked my wife to pick up a 32" TV,she knows I am a Samsung electronics follower,but she got this at such a good deal I wasnt mad,and I have to say it performs aswell(not better,(just a personal opinion)but as good as)it plays thru a Samsung Surround Sound System,has a great picture,set up was a breeze and has been very reliable,I do admit it doesnt get used much,about 20hrs a week give or take,but would consider buying again without hesitation were a Samsung not available or at a great price like what we paid for this one.Final assessment?GREAT TV,worth the $$$$$ and if you are a SONY person,this will give you reliable service for along time.'

Reviews.Title: a great product
Reviews.Author: waqar ahmed
Reviews.Content: A superb picture quality that I mounted on the wall you can view it from  any angle, no glare, or fading. I love it! Sony does make a difference in picture quality no other comes close to it. I would recommend this TV to anyone who is looking for a 32" LCD.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the Money
Reviews.Author: Larry W. Carnes
Reviews.Content: I bought it 4 months ago and have not had any problems.  I use it to receive broadcast TV via antenna and also for DVD viewing.  Picture quality is excellent, sound is good.  I just hope this model doesn't use the same components that Sony used in their 2008-2010 models.  The Internet is full of consumer complaints about Sony TVs mysteriously failing soon after the warranty expired, and the company not offering much if any compensation.

Reviews.Title: Sony BRAVIA
Reviews.Author: MamaT
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv for Christmas 2011, it already has lines on the screen. Definitely not happy. Great picture and loved it up until recently.

Reviews.Title: awesome little(bigger) tv
Reviews.Author: another crazy drummer
Reviews.Content: Have had a 55" Sony Bravia in the front room for a while and LOVE it. So, I got a 22" Sony Bravia for the back room (like a matching set!). Unfortunately, I lost the little guy in the divorce. Then that room was later converted into my drum studio (now that there's no more Precious Moments or Peanuts crap all over the place). But, I was still paying for the other receiver, and I thought it would be nice to have another smaller TV in the back of the house, maybe the kitchen? Then I couldn't find a 22" Bravia. Well, wouldn't you know, I have an island counter top in the kitchen with a cabinet above it, and I swear to god that cabinet was placed just at the right height so this 32" could fit perfectly underneath it! I heard poor reviews about the speakers on this TV, but I don't believe them at all. With the speakers set to the "Dynamic" mode: my kitchen is roughly 13' x 14', and when I'm sitting on the bar stool eating and watching the TV, or jamming one of the satellite music channels, it sometimes sounds like there is small set of speakers behind my fridge!!! So, stick it to your ex-wife, get a bigger TV than she has. Get this as your little TV!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Robert Larson III
Reviews.Content: I love the TV.  It came really quick and was easy to set up.  Great picture!!  It synced with my Sony Blue Ray automatically as expected.  Sony is worth the extra money to me.  I wish it has 1 more HDMI port.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: B B
Reviews.Content: I have had no issues with the Sony 32 inch.  Great Picture, good sound, looks good, what's not to like?  With that said, I have only had it for 2 months.  The true test will be it's long term performance. Will I still love it in 2 or 3 years?  I guess time will tell.

Reviews.Title: Easier than a child's toy
Reviews.Author: Capistrano
Reviews.Content: Delivered to my front door.  No pick-up,no waiting , hassle free. Easy set-up. Instructions clear and simple.Was delivered exactly the date posted.

Reviews.Title: Forget the budget brands, go with a proven HDTV maker
Reviews.Author: Jas
Reviews.Content: After experiencing disappointment with my Haier 32" HDTV purchase, I decided to go with a name brand, so I went with the Sony Bravia 32". The picture is good, as one would expect with this brand. The sound is also decent enough that I don't need to purchase additional speakers (as I likely would have had to do with the Haier's AM-radio sound). The Bravia has a nifty surround sound simulation feature that I utilize regularly during my television viewing. It gives a good affect.Pros:-Solid picture-Solid sound-USB input lets you play music, view pictures, and watch .MPG videos. The last part came as a surprise as I did not see this feature listed here.-2 composite (one doubles as component), 2 HDMI inputs-Fast channel changing-Can sync with some other Sony devicesCons:-No headphone out for private listening-My unit makes popping/cracking noises for about the first minute after you turn it on and after you turn it off.

Reviews.Title: Great Television!
Reviews.Author: Antwan L. Payne
Reviews.Content: It's been a few weeks since I've bought my Sony TV and I have been loving it!  My apartment complex has a custom cable package so that picture is subpar (as it would be on ANY TV).  But connected to my XBOX or PS3 with HDMI, the HD picture is amazing.  Blu-Ray and digital downloads look stunning!  Netflix and Hulu+ also look great.I have no complaints about this TV.  For a 32 inch TV, it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: Best HDTV ever.On less Sony decide to make a better one
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the sony Bravia and I love it already. It sounds great and the picture quality is one of the best I've seen.

Reviews.Title: Best 32" on the Market, its 1080p not 720p
Reviews.Author: pal
Reviews.Content: This SONY TV is amazing. Its worth the price, no other tv can match it, if your looking for a 32" get this one, Sony is known for quality and longevity, so if you want a good tv, get a Sony.Also it states its a 720p, but when i pluged in my ps3, it says the tv is 1080p, which is nice, the picture quality is amazing

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with your service
Reviews.Author: Herbert
Reviews.Content: With the service I received from Amazon I was very happyand I only can recommend there service and prices to anybody.Thank you Amazon for your service.I will keep in touch with you before I wil buy anything fromfrom sombody else.Herbert Winkler

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: zlindam "shirley"
Reviews.Content: As someone who still has basic cable service and was a teenager during the time of 8 tracks and transister radios, I can't give a review based on electronic expertise. But, I like what I like and The Sony Bravia is a very satisfying TV. We had been watching a Sony WEGA and love it. It has now gone in the bedroom. I was convinced that The WEGA had a picture very close to the LCD TV's. But, even without high definition service, this little LCD is amazing. Picture quality is excellent, the price was very good, on sale, sound quality is certainly good enough for me. After looking for an LCD that we could use in our livingroom, where we sit at a sharp angle from the screen, I know I made the right choice. At any angle the picture doesn't change. It was packaged very well. I had been worried that it could get damaged in shipping and we'd have to go through a hassle with that. But I was pleasantly surprised by the good condition of the box. It also arrived sooner that originally stated and I could track it's journey enroute. Couldn't bee happier. Great buy!!!

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased with the TV
Reviews.Author: TM
Reviews.Content: This was a christmas gift for my mom, she likes Sony TV's. After reading the reviews, and the good price, could not pass up. Wonderful picture, extremely easy to setup, picture was great right out of the box. No issues, very pleased with this purchase, great tv at a good price.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Chuck G. Mccumby
Reviews.Content: No problems and really like the TV. Good service, nice product. Good turn around time.Like Sony and most of their other products.

Reviews.Title: Sound Quality Seems Inferior to 40" Samsung.
Reviews.Author: RM
Reviews.Content: I would expect better sound quality from Sony, but my Samsung 40" (is bigger) and delivers much better sound. If you're brand-conscious, you expect the best from Sony. Don't rule out Samsung.

Reviews.Title: So far so good except for learning how to adjust the settings
Reviews.Author: Clear Blue "clearblue"
Reviews.Content: The tv was easy to set up and we got it in a very quick time. This was a purchase for my husband's Christmas and he uses it in the office. I need some expert advice on how to adjust the set so the picture isn't so soft and blurry. It is at factory settings right now. I have tried all the settings that come with the tv but it still has a blurry kind of foggy soft looking picture. I have it connected to our Dish via a satellite antenna cable 75ohm, the required cable. I have tried various ways to get the picture to look sharper without so much blurring around images but it just doesn't work. I have gone into all the controls for resolution, gamma, lightness, sharpness, picture modes, back lighting etc. Nothing resolves this. I also kept it off for several hours because it was cold when it was delivered and I read that sometimes coming from cold to warmth can cause it to be foggy or soft looking. Is it because I don't have an hdmi cable from the Dish receiver to the tv? I don't understand why it isn't as sharp as my old hatachi rear projection 52 inch tv I've had going on 15 years which is hooked up via a DVI cable because it was the first tv to come out with a DVI hookup. I think this is a great little TV especially for the price I paid for it 298.00 including shipping. I just wish I could understand more about how to hook it up to get the best picture. We have the old Hitachi in the family room by the Dish receiver. The Dish receiver has dual tuners and the Dish technician ran an outlet to the office. My husband use to watch TV using the computer with it's built in tuner and watched it using a program we downloaded from the internet. It was soft looking on the computer but I chalked it up to it being a computer thing and the monitor we have. I hope someone has the answers on how to get a better picture because I know this tv is capable of a better picture. I have a new cable on order from Amazon to see if that resolves the problem.  I read all the hookup guides but to have hdmi in the office I would have to have a 100 foot hdmi cable. If I have to do that to get a quality tv picture I will. Please post if you are technically gifted in this area so I can know what to do. Are all LCD TV's blurry when you sit within a certain distance? Just need some good input. Thanks for reading this and for replying if you have some good information.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia
Reviews.Author: RH
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can say bad about this LED Sony TV is that the formatting doesn't seem to be right. To be able to see the "Full" picture as intended, I have to put is in a format that has the black bars on top and bottom (wide screen).  When in zoom or full screen, it cuts out the video left and right.  Maybe this is normal, I don't know?

Reviews.Content: Just another mexican made piece of junk. I had it 4 months and now it wont turn on. If I want it fixed I have to travel 200 miles to drop it off at a sony shipping site, to be shipped to Texas so they can send me a refurbished one. So 400 miles round trip, 8 hours out of my day, come on sony really, really. I will never buy any thing sony again.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia LCD HDTV 32 Inch
Reviews.Author: Jesus Baduil
Reviews.Content: this Tv look great in my bedroom is the perfect size for him I connect my PS3 on tv and show a resolution of 1080p the experience in videogame is amazing I'm Happy with this purchage The TV arrived in good condition thank amazon again

Reviews.Title: Good Picture
Reviews.Author: Robert H. Steinberg "RivieraRob"
Reviews.Content: Decent picture. Could be a little bit brighter but I have to learn the controls. I don't have HD so I am not sure how good the picture quality can be, but it is certainly much clearer than an analog.

Reviews.Title: Sony BRAVIA 32-Inch LCS HDTV Flatscreen
Reviews.Author: Kevin K.
Reviews.Content: The picture is so clear and the colors so vibrant. You can't go wrong with this Sony LCD HDTV flatscreen!

Reviews.Title: everything as expected and more!
Reviews.Author: wattson
Reviews.Content: This Sony tv worths every cent, its not 720p, is 1080p! i noticed about this when the tv automaticly synced my PS3 with my HDMI cable. Everything is ok.

Reviews.Title: 32-Inch Sony Bravia
Reviews.Author: david huang
Reviews.Content: Nice picture.  Good Sound.  This is my first HDTV with a built in tuner.  Perhaps most have a latency when you first turn the set on and then when you flip channels before you see/hear the tuned in station.  However, it's not what I'm used to (i.e., still using two old analog sets).  Also, I've tried getting the TV to search and find all channels...I've since learned I really need to get a cable box if I want access to all the channels that I'm paying for in my cable subscription.  ...need to get current with the technology.

Reviews.Title: Control of volume on external speakers LIMITED
Reviews.Author: Joe the Nurse
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV yesterday. The picture is great, but the sound on the internal speakers is mediocre.  I hooked it up to external speakers via my receiver.  The problem is that this television's remote control will only control the volume on the television's internal speakers -- not the volume of the external speaker output.  So your options are: to get up off the sofa whenever you need to adjust the volume/mute sound; to use a receiver that has its own remote control; or to live with the mediocre internal speakers alone.  This was not an issue with my prior TV: when I modified the volume or muted with the TV remote, all sound outputs followed suit.  I have confirmed this limitation with Sony.  Either I will return the TV, or I will have to fork out money for a receiver that has a remote sensor.  If I am lucky, the cable box's remote will sync with the new receiver so I won't have to be using yet another remote.

Reviews.Content: I bought this tv 6 months ago. Two weeks after having it both HDMI port went bad.  Now our board in the tv is bad.  I will never buy a sony again it has been the worst experience ever.  Not worth the money that I paid for it.

Reviews.Content: Grate tv for money ,I use this tv as PC monitor Which is not as good as 1080 P monitor.
